decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay while generating card advantage with Ancestral Vision and Shardless Agent. The deck aims to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and by applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Deathrite Shaman. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the three-color combination of black, blue, and green, allowing for a variety of powerful spells to be cast throughout the game.

The deck focuses on playing disruptive spells early to control the opponent's hand and board, while also gaining an advantage with card advantage through Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library. It prioritizes mana efficiency with a mix of efficient removal and threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf. The deck aims to apply pressure quickly and efficiently through efficient creatures and burn spells, while also maintaining control over the opponent's resources through discard spells and removal. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a fast clock to close out the game.

The deck is focused on using Show and Tell to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play early, while protecting the combo with counter magic like Spell Pierce and Force of Will. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats and win the game quickly before they have a chance to respond. Sneak Attack provides additional ways to put creatures into play, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help to dig for combo pieces. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, aiming to win the game in just a few turns.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and True-Name Nemesis to dominate the game while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte provide additional value and threats. The deck aims to control the game through counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, removal like Swords to Plowshares, and versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage. The mana base supports a variety of powerful spells while also providing access to different colors of mana for flexibility.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while rapidly building a board presence. By utilizing disruption spells such as Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay, along with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, the deck aims to control the game tempo. Meanwhile, aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman provide quick damage and pressure to the opponent. The deck also incorporates card advantage engines such as Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to maintain resources and outvalue the opponent.

The core strategy of this deck is to quickly deploy threats like Tarmogoyf, Nimble Mongoose, and Delver of Secrets while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will, Stifle, and Spell Pierce. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Wasteland and Lightning Bolt, while also manipulating its own draws with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. By putting pressure on the opponent early and efficiently using its cheap spells, this deck seeks to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the game while applying early pressure with cheap and efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Stifle, Daze, and Force of Will, the deck aims to maintain tempo and prevent the opponent from establishing a board presence. The deck also utilizes card selection and manipulation tools like Ponder and Brainstorm to find the necessary pieces to keep the pressure on and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and tempo by utilizing cheap and efficient spells like Spell Snare, Spell Pierce, and Stifle while also pressuring the opponent with quick creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Nimble Mongoose. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while quickly closing out the game with aggressive creatures. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to both red and green mana sources to support the aggressive strategy.

The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Tombstalker. It also disrupts the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells like Abrupt Decay and Hymn to Tourach. The deck is designed to control the game through card advantage provided by Brainstorm and Liliana of the Veil while keeping the opponent's board state in check with cards like Wasteland. Overall, the deck seeks to establish an advantage in the early game and maintain it throughout the match to secure a win.

The main idea of this Legacy Aggro - Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Phyrexian Revoker, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Wasteland while establishing a fast aggro presence with creatures like Mirran Crusader and Serra Avenger. The deck also utilizes powerful equipment such as Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to increase the damage output of its creatures. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient mana usage and instant-speed creature deployment. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and pressure the opponent into making costly mistakes.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, alongside powerful disruptive spells like Liliana of the Veil and Thoughtseize, to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck also includes a strong mana denial package with cards like Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman, to keep opponents off balance. Additionally, the deck has versatile removal options in Abrupt Decay, Punishing Fire, and Lightning Bolt, to deal with a wide range of threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The primary goal of this deck is to quickly and efficiently put powerful, game-ending creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Entomb, Exhume, and Reanimate. The deck includes a variety of high-impact creatures such as Griselbrand, Elesh Norn, and Iona, which can quickly turn the tide of the game in the player's favor. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, as well as hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize. Show and Tell can also be utilized to cheat creatures into play without the need for reanimation.

The main idea of this Legacy deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize while setting up card advantage with Ancestral Vision. The deck is focused on a proactive playstyle, utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Deathrite Shaman, and Shardless Agent to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes powerful control elements like Force of Will and Brainstorm to protect its creatures and maintain board presence. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through a combination of disruption, card advantage, and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes the Stoneforge Mystic package to search for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further control the board and win the game. Additionally, the deck plays Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek combo for additional win conditions and synergy. The inclusion of Shardless Agent provides card advantage and allows for cascading into powerful spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game with a mix of disruption, card advantage, and efficient threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through disruption, removal, and powerful threats. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Liliana of the Veil, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also deploying threats like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic to close out the game. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage and control. With a mix of hand disruption, removal spells, and efficient threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents in a grindy, control-based matchup.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo Storm deck aims to quickly generate a large amount of mana through rituals and fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond. The deck then uses Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to search for and cast key combo pieces like Ad Nauseam or Empty the Warrens to win the game in a single explosive turn. The deck also includes disruption spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy to control the opponent's hand and protect its own combo pieces.
